alert.note: Alert for Decatur; Seminole (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 27 at 3:32PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT JACKSON...GULF...EASTERN BAY AND CALHOUN COUNTIES IN THE PANHANDLE OF FLORIDA...WESTERN GADSDEN AND LIBERTY COUNTIES IN BIG BEND FLORIDA...SOUTHEASTERN WASHINGTON COUNTY IN THE PANHANDLE OF FLORIDA...NORTHWESTERN FRANKLIN COUNTY IN BIG BEND FLORIDA...SOUTHWESTERN DECATUR AND SOUTHERN SEMINOLE COUNTIES IN SOUTHWESTERN GEORGIA THROUGH 415 PM EDT/315 PM CDT/... At 332 PM EDT/232 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles southeast of Donalsonville to 8 miles east of Stonemill Creek. Movement was south at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Panama City, Lynn Haven, Callaway, Blountstown, Marianna, Port St. Joe, Apalachicola, Springfield, Mexico Beach, Hiland Park, Stonemill Creek, Chattahoochee, Greensboro, Tyndall Air Force Base, Orange, Parker, Malone, Wewahitchka, Sneads, and Bristol. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
